level.text: In accordance with section 2320 of the Act, the official superior of an employee, or an employee, shall report by telephone to the Program any injury which results in that employee’s death or probable disability. Claims shall be reported to the Program by calling the phone number for this purpose that is published on ORM’s website.

The official superior shall report the claim to ORM by telephone within twenty-four (24) hours of the incident, injury, or death. No later than three (3) days after the initial report, the official superior shall report the claim, in writing, using Form 1, the Employer and Employee First Report of Injury or Occupational Disease, and Form 2, Supervisor’s Report.
The official superior of the employee shall supply all information requested by the Program.
Form 1 shall contain the following information:
The name and address of the employer;
The name and address of the employee;
The year, month, day, and hour when the injury or death occurred;
The name and telephone number of the employee’s official superior;
The employee’s occupation at the time of the injury or death;
The employee’s wage or base salary information;
The length of the employee’s employment;
The location of the accident;
A description of the events which resulted in the death, injury, or disease;
The type of injury; and
The body parts affected.
Form 2 shall contain the following information:
Whether the official superior witnessed the accident;
Whether the employee reported the accident or injury, and to whom;
Whether an incident report was prepared in connection with the injury or death;
The nature of the injuries the employee complained of;
Whether the employee has been placed on Continuation of Pay (COP);
Whether the employee was in the performance of duty at the time of injury or death;
A description of the events which resulted in the death, injury, or disease; and
A copy of the employee’s position description and all incident reports.
The official superior shall complete and submit supplemental reports to the ORM as requested. The supplemental reports shall contain, but not be limited to:
Statements from witnesses confirming or refuting the employee’s allegations concerning the accident or injury;
Statements, where requested, to give additional details of the accident or incident;

Statements regarding whether the employee, to the official superior’s knowledge, had a similar injury prior to the alleged injury, and if so, full details of the prior injury or incident and associated medical reports; and
Statements of other injuries or accidents of a similar character and the full details.
The official superior shall complete Form CA-3, Report of Return to Duty.
